item.title: By: Hang
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: I finally gave up the idea of letting Cassandra determines the token for partition by itself, at least for those initial nodes. Obviously it is not doing that great and doing nodeprobe loadbalance later is painful.
item.content:encoded: I finally gave up the idea of letting Cassandra determines the token for partition by itself, at least for those initial nodes. Obviously it is not doing that great and doing nodeprobe loadbalance later is painful.

item.title: By: Hang
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: I tried svn version of cassandra (so-called 5.0-beta2), which ... signaficantly improved key distribution, as well as the performance. These two improvement gave me much better result, though I need to figure out if there is anything that I can improved or not.
item.content:encoded: I tried svn version of cassandra (so-called 5.0-beta2), which … signaficantly improved key distribution, as well as the performance. These two improvement gave me much better result, though I need to figure out if there is anything that I can improved or not.

item.title: By: Hang
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description:
I found one problem ... which is pretty obvious but I didn't notice - my test data set is too big to fit into memory, so it start swapping which significantly slow down the system.
I'm tuning my data set now, while changing codes as well (for thread safe), will see.
item.content:encoded:
I found one problem … which is pretty obvious but I didn’t notice – my test data set is too big to fit into memory, so it start swapping which significantly slow down the system.

I’m tuning my data set now, while changing codes as well (for thread safe), will see.
